content.p: The 2019 amendment, effective April 2, 2019, added the third through sixth sentences in subparagraph (a)(1)(C) and added the last sentence in subparagraph (a)(1)(D).

The 2021 amendment, effective July 1, 2021, rewrote subparagraph (a)(1)(B); in subparagraph (a)(1)(C), substituted "the identifying information entered on the absentee ballot envelope does not match the same information appearing in the elector's vote registration record" for "the signature does not appear to be valid" near the beginning of the first sentence, and substituted "nonmatching identifying information" for "an invalid signature" near the beginning of the fourth sentence; rewrote paragraph (a)(2);; deleted "open the inner envelopes in accordance with the procedures prescribed in this subsection and" following "election, or runoff" in the first sentence of paragraph (a)(3); in paragraph (a)(5), substituted "absentee ballot envelopes, scanning absentee ballots, and" for "the inner envelopes of and" and "conducted in a manner" for "a confidential process" in the first sentence; substituted "email" for "e-mail" in the second sentence of paragraph (a)(6); and added "except as otherwise provided in this Code section" at the end of paragraph (a)(7); rewrote subsection (b); in subsection (c), substituted "The superintendent shall cause the verified and accepted absentee ballots to be opened and tabulated as provided in this Code section. A manager" for "Except as otherwise provided in this Code section, after the close of the polls on the day of the primary, election, or runoff, a manager" at the beginning and deleted ", and prepare an election return for the county or municipality showing the results of the absentee ballots cast in such county or municipality." at the end; and added the second through fourth sentences in subsection (d).
